doc.after: The adult of the "nominate" subspecies of the red-billed chough, P. p. pyrrhocorax, is 39â40Â centimetres (15â16Â in) in length, has a 73â90Â centimetres (29â35Â in) wingspan,[21] and weighs an average 310Â grammes (10.9Â oz).[4] Its plumage is velvet-black, green-glossed on the body, and it has a long curved red bill and red legs. The sexes are similar (although adults can be sexed in the hand using a formula involving tarsus length and bill width)[22] but the juvenile has an orange bill and pink legs until its first autumn, and less glossy plumage.[9]
